metadata.title: CVE-2019-20393 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A double-free is present in libyang before v1.0-r1 in the functionyyparse() when an empty description is used. Applications that use libyangto parse untrusted input yang files may be vulnerable to this flaw, whichwould cause a crash or potentially code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libyang-cpp1 - 1.0.176-1
libyang-tools - 1.0.176-1
libyang1 - 1.0.176-1
yang-tools - 1.0.176-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libyang package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.176-1').
